page.title: 14JOYCE WHITMARSH'S DAY
page.content: I wake up at about 5.50 a.m.and do not have a breakfast. Then I might do some housework until 8 a.m. At that time I then set off to work, which is just across the road at a commercial printers called Newsomes. Half an hour for lunch is just long enough to come home for a light snack, which I dont mind as I am on a diet. Work finishes at 4.30 p.m. After work I come home and prepare a meal for 6 p.m. when my husband, who is an emergency planning officer at County Hall in Wakefield, comes home. After our evening meal we usually watch television or read the papers. On the days I do not work I like to do a bit of reading, knitting or gardening. At night I usually go to bed at 11 p.m. but before then I feed Heidi, my cat, and another stray that lives with us.{J.Humpleby Batley G.S
